content: I don't know how many folks are available today given US holiday -- I'm planning on attending if there's a meeting though.
I'm available to meet, but no objections if folks want to skip
I was hoping for a meeting today specifically because i'm at home and able to do the meeting.
I can't make it today, but I have no objection if others want to conduct the meeting
(I was just coming on to mention this...)

@nikomatsakis At some point, it would be helpful if people other than you could drive the automation that you created to automatically create meeting agendas. Do you have time to run that and create a template for today?
I can likely run it - it "just" needs a GitHub token
Could you give it a try in advance?
I might not get to it unfortunately, not at a computer yet
trying to now
okay I have an agenda, but not sure where to put it
I guess we did hackmd last time?
cc @Josh Triplett
https://hackmd.io/@simulacrum/BJvxMWV4D
That works. Thanks!
created by cargo run --bin lang-agenda in rust-lang/triagebot, no tokens needed for just the one run (you'll run up against github rate limits pretty quick though with multiple)
OK, the hackmd at https://hackmd.io/XL3k7pFoSJ2-hITjseA3cw?both contains the agenda we used, and should be archived in the lang-team repo.
Thanks everyone!
And to make sure: I'm currently not supposed to be merging the align(ptr) charter -- I was, but with the concern I'm no longer.
Right.
You can merge declarative macro repetition counts though.
